title: Banned
body: I was falsely banned. After my two chat restrictions, I reformed for 9 months. And I got full honor. Suddenly one game, I say bad a couple of times, noob also, because a feeding alistar in ranked was spam pinging me and saying way worse things. So it was supposed to go back to chat restriction cause I reformed, but it went to temp....??? Then eventually I got a perma. I never say anything worse than trash, and I rarely say that. just noob and bad sometimes. I don't know how saying bad and noob a couple of times skips my reform?? it was an error to ban me because I wasn't reported for 9 months and reform is a thing but I guess its bugged. I lost my level 210 account that I spent two years on and hundreds of dollars to an error in reform. Each time I go to riot support, they say that it "wasn't an error" but they don't even explain why. And it wasn't an error anyways sooo

replies.body:
Logs could help identify what lead to punishment this time.

As for the past, 9 months doesn't actually tell us anything. It doesn't tell use how often you played in those 9 months. It doesn't tell us if you still called people bad/noob/etc; which would slow your reformation.
I played every day and refused to use chat unless saying good job etc. reformation is about 3 months for a temp ban and that was a chat restriction sooo

3 months isn't a guarantee. That is/was a rough estimate. There is no magic number.

Edit: What was the cause of the 14 day ban? If you used hate speech or encouraged self harm, that gives an escalated punishment usually.
Still though
Out of curiosity, do you remember what the Alistar said? Did you repeat any of what he said?
Why would I repeat what he said. Ill give you a censored version. **** you idiot we are losing cause of your stupid *** losing the game. **** off. your ****. {{item:2056}}
Because people repeat stuff when they ask for reports. That is why I asked.

> I reformed for 9 months. And I got full honor. Suddenly one game, I say bad a couple of times, noob also

Doesn't sound reformed at all.
It was ranked and I had a purposely feeding alistar that was spam pinging me for carrying the game. So it does sound like reform
The rules don't say "You're allowed to flame people if they're being assholes."
Yeah but saying noob doesn't make me skip reform. I know someone that was banned and 3 months later, even being toxic the whole time in reforming they got a chat restriction instead of perma ban.

> Yeah but saying noob doesn't make me skip reform.

Yes, yes it does. You saying you're reformed doesn't mean anything if your **actions** don't back it up. The system considers you **not reformed**.
Someone I know says way worse things and "reformed" for barely 3 months after temp ban saying bad stuff all the way through and went back to chat restrictions. So that's fair!
I don't know what to tell you. The system has correctly punished **you**. What's it's doing or not doing for someone else is irrelevant.
I am afraid that they haven't banned me correctly. Sorry you don't agree.
The rules do say "Competetive BSing is fine, but racial slurs have no place in league" also something like "games can get heated"

Insulting/flaming people is not competitive BSing.

Competitive BSing is things like "lol nice flash" after the enemy wastes it in lane.
Buddy, saying noob is for things like that. Like when they waste ult for no reason im like what the noob lol

No, noob is an insult. Insulting people is not appropriate.

Competitive BS is not insulting - it's just that - BS. "nice flash lol" is different from "nice flash noob". One is an insult. One is simply poking fun.
Not my fault that majority of league players get offended from saying noob once. Simply put, chill
You don't have to agree with the rules, but you do have to follow them. It is your fault if you refuse to follow the rules.
Well I mean maybe riot needs to fix the rules then. That is not my fault their rules are biased
To what protected or unchangeable class are they biased/against? It's not bias to favor the opinion of the majority over that of the minority - that's called polling/normal life.

Minorities matter. Say (this is an example) that suddenly everyone that likes pizza in America is killed and the majority voted that. Its bad but like you said, apparently it isn't bias to favor majority.
This isn't voting to kill anyone. And the rules are clearly stated. You're allowed to provide your input to the rules. But you disagreeing does not give you the right to say "fuck the rules".
Fixing what point of their rules exactly?
Just about everything, to be exact

Reform is not based on time or your claim you reformed. It is based on your behavior. I sincerely doubt you went from honor 0 or 1 to honor level 5 in 9 months, especially given that honor reset at the beginning of the season.

You also have no way of knowing you were never reported over 9 months.
Ok I went high in honor not honor 5 sheesh and I had good behavior goodness.
"High honor", I doubt this too, because you were obviously either not playing enough to show reform, or you were still misbehaving.
I played multiple games every day, so yes I played enough, and no I wasn't misbehaving. You can ask riot if they remember my riot support thing when I had honor 3 and didn't get seasonal rewards.

So, this is even more contradictory - honor 3 players were all given season rewards. Full stop. You would be the first person I have heard that had honor 3 at the end of the season but did not get their rewards (and there were a *lot* of complaints).

Look, the bottom line is this - you don't get to decide reform, Riot does. And given your defensive attitude here and the fact that we've caught you in what are at best you misspeaking and at worst you directly lying to us, I see no reason to think you were reformed in game. In fact, in other replies here, you display multiple hallmarks of toxic attitude - that it's okay as long as it's a "mild" insult, and that it's okay as long as the other player is doing something worse. Neither of those are indicative of reform.

I suspect that when you were communicating with the Support staff, you likely displayed some of the same behaviors you did here - they saw right through that and even if you *did* come close to showing reform, your communications to them shot you in the foot.
So trolls In ranked are worse than people that say noob. that sure is fair! and not my fault I was scammed of hundreds of dollars from getting falsely banned.

In fact, trolls are given a 14 day ban on the first confirmed occurrence. You had two chances to reform before you were given a 14 day ban.

Your ban was not false, and you were not scammed, period. You seem to be unwilling to understand this, though, so I hope you have a nice day.
And I did reform buddy. 9 months is a thing.
No, you didn't, and your behavior in this thread shows you still have the same toxic attitude that was the problem.
It was an error. sorry you fail to see that.
Then you need to speak with Riot support and tell them it was an error. Nobody here is Riot Support.
I did. they directed me to here to get a dev

No, what they said is that you are requesting them to change the rules. They told you your punishment was not in error, and that they do not change the rules - they provide player support. You have gotten your final response from Riot on this matter - they have determined your punishment is not in error, and that it will not be removed. Your disagreement with the rules or with their determination does not change either of those.
goodness you're annoying just stop talking
yeah I mean that is kinda true he is being annoying.
Maybe you are willing to provide us more detailed and complete information? E.g. you already got asked what was the cause of your 14-day-ban.

Ok. I was playing ranked as  {{champion:6}} . Throughout the whole game {{champion:12}} is intentionally feeding the enemy team and I don't mind. But he also spam pings me and says super toxic stuff to me throughout the whole game. So I tell alistar don't flame me for no reason if you aren't even doing good. noob
Chatlogs, please.
everyone I know that was banned hates ban rules, so I mean we cant just have people that haven't been banned permanently speaking here{{champion:30}}
True
